page.title: 15THE ECOLOGY OF RUNCORN
page.content: {4.Reclaimed land.Wigg Island.} Formerly a heavily industrialised area,producing alkali, chlorines,copper,sulpher and mustard gas (1863_1945).The whole area has now been reclaimed and is owned by Halton Borough Council.The old plant and works have been demolished and the land has been capped with concrete which has then been covered with imported top soil.The site is currently undergoing landscaping for use as a public recreation area. {Plant distribution:}On the meadow lands we found 5 species of grass and 15 different kinds of herbs.On the newly planted areas were 6 native trees and various species of shrub.The undergrowth has been controlled by spraying.The estuary and salt marsh were not accessible to the public. Little evidence yet of animal life.
